title: Adjunct Professor Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT)
Interview Descriptions: Comprehensive, thoughtful and focused on the content and subject matter. It was clear that they had high expectations for their faculty (whether part time or full time). They care deeply about their students and the profession
Interview Questions: What is your experience with xxx content area?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place in a beautiful conference room on the top floor of the library where faculty asked standard questions about previous education. The interview was 3 on 1.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with adversity? Give an example.

title: Graduate Assistant - Research Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: Fast and communicative. Overall great experience, everyone was really awesome and nice and informative. Also everyone was really helpful with answering any questions I had. All employees seem very knowledgeable and I am thankful to have gotten the opportunity to interview with them.
Interview Questions: What is your managing style?

title: Director of Diversity and Inclusion Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process went well but the university seemed very new when it came to staffing this position. I believe it was a one man department.  I believe this was the first Director in the this position.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your diversity equality and inclusion experience.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: It was a casual conversation. Just be yourself and speak with the flow.  They will test your ability to hold a  conversation and if you have a good accent. Moreover, if you know someone working in that position, then reference definitely helps.
Interview Questions: Why this position?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: The process was fair to every student and involve training but process changes for every professor and gives better on-campus employment opportunity. Based on the requirement for the class assistantship is usually given to the student who is interested and knowledgeable in that area
Interview Questions: Regarding skills and interest

title: Guest Relations Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT)
Interview Descriptions: You apply using the UB portal and someitmes have to write an essay that they probably dont even read. The interview is quick they just want to make sure you follow the rules and dont give your friends benefits.
Interview Questions: Simple tell me about yourself question

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: Its is mostly on your gpa and ur performance in the school. Sometimes it may work on seniors recommendations but it is usually on your capability to do.  The professors also some times see you and offer you the position. without any official applying for the position
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Starting with a short 20 minute phone interview, was then invited back for an in-person panel interview. Everyone was extremely friendly and asked thought-invoking questions. There were approximately 6 individuals on the panel interview. They each would ask a question and move around the room. After the panel interview, I continued a one-on-one discussion with the director of the department.
Interview Questions: If you could be a kitchen appliance, what would you be and why?

title: ESL Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: It was great experience. I had an interview with two interviewers who are an ESL program director and an assistant director. They made me so comfortable during the whole interview.
Interview Questions: Great

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions related to subject. Propulsion is my major. I have done bachelors degree in aeronautical background and masters in mechanical so that I can expand my wings of scope to get good job related to mechanical or aeronautical field
Interview Questions: Can I give 100% commitment to the job I was assigned with

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Since it was a student worker position, the application process was easy. You drop your resume at the front desk, and if they select your resume for further consideration, they will call you for a phone interview. After that, you will be called for an in-person interview with the manager. If you get through that phase then you will be called for a final round interview with the director of the department. It felt like a casual conversation. No need to stress. Just be yourself and make sure you put strong soft skills in your resume.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and comfortable. My interview was taken by the Graduate Assistance of the Security Department. She made me very comfortable. They asked me about my class schedule. I was told all the protocols that I was supposed to follow and that was it.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my Class Schedule

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied directly to the Head of the Department, through e-mail. Contacted by e-mail for an interview. Panel interview with 6-7 panelists in a small room. Typical interview questions, asked in turn by each panelist. Relatively long, in-depth interview. Follow-up occurred once funding for the position had been confirmed, about a month later.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little bit about yourself.

title: Student Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Three interview phases, first submit resume, then in person with a panel of ambassadors counselor and supervisor, then a group interview. The resume phase can be skipped if you are referred by a current of former employee.
Interview Questions: What are three things that stand out to you when you get on campus

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Grade in core subjects and Basic knowledge of particular subject. This position is for advance database course, so few questions related to that. What is data modeling? How RDBMS work? What are the other types of data model now a days in market? B+ indexing?
Interview Questions: Did you have previous experience for GA?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport
Interview Descriptions: Interview process went well. I was asked good questions in which it prepared me for other interviews. The process went well and I felt prepared. The employer was very good and articulated well, they also told me what they expected from me and what I could expect from them.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't really a hiring process because I am a graduate student in the department and have a good academic standing so I was offered the position per recommendation of the Dean of my college. I wrote that I got paid in the other questions but Graduate assistantships are paid for by way of credits so you do not get direct payment, You do get a stipend of about 800$ per every three credits.
Interview Questions: Although there was not really a formal interview,  still met with the professors to discuss the position and what it entailed.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: you send your resume first and once you get selected, you will have a face to face interview. In hte interview you will be asked basic questions about yourself and how did you knew about the job, then i was required to take a simple test of organizing method of books.
Interview Questions: organizing books using the library of congress method?

title: Adjunct Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit my application online. Got a email the next day from the department director.He asked me to go to the school for an interview. We finally met a week later and he offered me the position the same day.
Interview Questions: Which day of the week and what time can you come to school for the course you teach?

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I contacted a friend who works there and asked if there was any opening and after was told that there was an opening, I sent my resume and a cover letter after reading through the job posting on their website. I was told I was a little late in the process as they had already interviewed 4 people but that I should still apply and so I did. I was subsequently called in for an interview with two directors which lasted approximately 40 minutes.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Adjunct Professor - African American History Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I completed the necessary application form, submitted requested documentation pertaining to my academic degrees, transcripts, and professional references to the Human Resources Department.  I was interviewed by the Dean, College of Arts and Sciences and also the Professor and Head of the Department of History.
Interview Questions:
1.  How long have I been teaching within the higher education system.
2.  How long have I taught African American History, and where/when did I start teaching the course?
3.  What were my experiences teaching the African American History course to a diverse group of adult students?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was a great experience and discuss the skills and abilities to perform as teaching or graduate assistant to help great teachers in School of Engineering of University of Bridgeport. It requires confidence and patience to handle research work as well as helping current students. It gives a great opportunity to build oneself to see from different views and build oneself to strive for excellence.
Interview Questions: What are technical skills do you have?

title: International Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Bridgeport (Bridgeport, CT) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied with an email on 2/28/2013.  Received a call from the Assistant Director on 2/22/2013 to for an interview on 2/25/2013.  I live in NYC so I just took the Metro North there. Met with the Dean of Admissions and the Assistant Director.  Interview went well, very relaxed.  Questions were straight forward.  Seems like a nice place to work. The city of Bridgeport is very rundown.
Interview Questions: All questions straight forward.
